I found the bug. It was caused because the constructor of the preference page
had protected access. Anyway, a better warning should be printed.

Eclipse intentionally does not catch NullPointerExceptions - these are 
intentionally reported as a serious error in order that the developer does not 
accidentally allow these sort of errors to slip by and make them impossible to 
trace.
